Reviews.Title: Keeps time and Plays Music
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Time: It keeps good timeBattery: Depending on how often you use it for more than time keeping purposes, it lasts at least a whole day. Wish the spare battery had a way of being chardged without swaping it outAudio: Quality form little speaker is good, headphones are good, blue tooth quality is goodCamera: Considering how small it is, and the fact that it is a watch, the quality is decentVideo: I have yet to find a video that will play on it. I keep getting a "file too large" error, kinda sucks because it was one of the 2 reasons I bought it... still trying though.Reception: To be expected, the reception is good outside but just ok inside. What do expect from a "cell phone" that is the size of a silver dollarLast but not lease!Look and Feel: It looks like a real nice watch and feels nice on the wrist. The band is adjustable as well

Reviews.Title: Quality, Well Designed Cell Phone Watch
Reviews.Author: Phillip L. Avery
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I have been using Cell phone watches exclusively since 2008 and have experience with multiple designs. The TW810 is my 4th watch phone and is by far the best of them all.I will start with its design. The TW810 is all steel, looks and feels great. It is very durable and amazingly does not look like a cell phone watch at all. It is very sleek, not too thick and professional looking. I could easily wear this with a suit to a business meeting and probably get compliments on my watch because it looks that good and normal. If you want a futuristic strange looking cell watch that people will notice this is not it. If you want a good looking watch that people will compliment and then be amazed when you tell the it is your phone this is the watch you want.Now for the real reason you are reading this, how does it work. The short answer is really really well. I am on the AT&T; network and have good strong coverage anywhere I go. I have not dropped a call yet and the calls I make are clear. Other watches in the past were hit and miss as far as call quality and reception. I make my calls using Bluetooth and have had no trouble with this as well. It always find as my headset and when you play music or videos on your watch the sound will play over the bluetooth. You can even stream your sound to a stereo speaker if you want some background music while you work.If you do not have a headset the sound from the built in mic/speaker is amazing for a cell phone watch. It's way better than any of the others I have owned.  It isn't high quality sound but if you want to show friends a video or play a song so all can here it does a good job.Now to the interface again the TW810 excels with its interface. I have had other watches that had very goofy Chinese graphics of hearts, unicorns and angels flying around or hot air balloons etc... that you could not turn off or change. These were embarrassing and totally unprofessional meaning I could not use those watches while in a meeting for fear some strange Chinese music would play or goofy graphic show while meeting with clients. The interface of the TW810 is well designed. The graphics are large and clean and set up in a fairly logical way, the way Europeans or Americans such as myself would expect. Some functions are a little buried but once you figure out where they are they are easy to call up and use.Now onto the advanced features, Internet use and Java apps. It took me a long time to figure out how to get this watch to connect to the Internet through the AT&T; network. The AT&T; store tried for me but couldn't quite get it to connect. I had to search the Internet, finding multiple sets of archaic settings which I just had to keep trying until finally getting it to work. I wanted to connect mainly for Java Apps. The screen is really too small to be useful for Internet browsing and the connections I managed to get are slow. A lot of the web pages have scripts that will not allow them to load or be viewed so web surfing is hit or miss for me on AT&T.; Other networks may work better.The built in Java App Store is a Chinese store so totally useless unless you can read Chinese. I could find no way to change this default App Store. Also, the Aoace brand is never listed anywhere on any site as a choice so downloading an app is totally hit and miss. I have no idea which phone to pick to make sure the app is sized to work on my watch. I have had some luck but not much so far. The built in Twitter and Facebook apps won't work but the MSN one does. All in all Java and the Internet is a total crap shoot. If I figure out which phone is compatible with the watch or the exact resolution or type of Java app the watch can play it would probably work well but after a week of scouring the Internet I have yet to find that information.I have had no trouble connecting to the TW810 using Bluetooth to my Mac to transfer files between the two. It is fast and works very well. You can also connect it directly to your computer using the supplied USB cable. Another good thing is that this watch uses a standard USB mini cable. Other watches I have owned had their own proprietary connectors and cables. If the cable goes bad on this one you can easily replace it with a standard USB mini cable you can buy anywhere.Unfortunately when I purchased this watch it came with a charger that had a three prong foreign plug. Fortunately I had another charger that worked fine or if I didn't I could have plugged it into my computer to charge. I do not know if this was just a mistake on the sellers part or if they all come that way but you may want to be ready to get he wrong adapter when you order.I highly recommend this cell phone watch and am pretty sure this will be the last one I will need to buy until Apple makes an iWatch!

Reviews.Title: Takes time to get use to
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: This watch/phone is excellent for those who are looking for a more practical phone. The phone main functions are time, sending/receiving calls, and text message.The watch is a fairly normal size watch, the buttons may be tiny for some people. The part that I had to get used to is the texting. Texting is not like your new smartphone where you get the keyboard layout nor through swype. You have to do it the old school way and press the number key every time to get to a certain letter. For example, if I were to type out "search" I would have to press '7' 4 times, '3' 2 times, '2' 1 time, '7' 3 times, and '4' 2 times. Would have helped if manufacturer included a T9 setting which would make texting a less painful experience.As for phone calls, the speaker, to my amazement, is fairly loud and you can hear the other end. If you want some privacy, it also comes with a cheap headset that does the job. The phone is also a good audio player although don't expect any bass from it.One thing about checking the time that may be a hindrance, is that the screen turns off after a certain amount of time so you have to press one of the buttons to view the time. The problem with this is, for example, if you're on the job and working with both hands and need to check the time, you'll have to put down what ever your holding to do so.

Reviews.Title: A really fun watch
Reviews.Author: Tristinfate
Reviews.Content: Everything works great so far, battery lasts longer than I expected and you get two.There is even an expandable stylus hidden in the band that I discovered days after using the watch.I would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Bought this watch and it lasted only 3 months with careful use. No over charging, no water, no shock or abuse. Just want turn on any more.

Reviews.Title: Would not buy again
Reviews.Author: Spencer
Reviews.Content: Could not connect too the Internet?Could not find a Provider.I would not buy again..Did not come with a memory Card

Reviews.Title: Great watch
Reviews.Author: SoiArt
Reviews.Content: I have bought a few and this by far the best in terms of its size, it is not as bulky as other brands and works perfectly.would be nice if it could come with a capacitive screen instead of a resistive one.

Reviews.Title: smart, nice idea, actually works well.
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: A good looking and feeling watch. Solidly built. Obviously a little bulky considering all the tech inside, but by no means uncomfortable. It actually works as a phone quite well, as long as you use the included (or other) bluetooth earpiece. The built in speaker is pretty weak. I put a $10 T-mobile SIM card in it to check reception around the area, and it is fine.The reason for 3/5 stars is that the touch screen interface is a bit iffy. it often registers the 'touch' (fingernail or stylus) in a different place to where it was actually was, therefore actually dialing a number took a long time to get right. You are better off preloading the address book with your contacts and selecting from there. But, overall, a really slick toy which I intend to use when I visit the UK next month.

Reviews.Title: TW810 Watch Phone
Reviews.Author: Keith R.
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a pretty cool watch till I noticed the band broke up by the speaker. it don't do anything it should like you set a ring tone, it plays the factory set ring tone so why have that feature. well I would not recommend this watch to my worst enemy sorry but I would like a refund and they can have it back......

Reviews.Title: goog product
Reviews.Author: Radu Tugulia
Reviews.Content: Product does what it said and works great. If you are a texting person that will be a problem ,but overall good product. Easy to set up I will recommend a good Bluetooth for a good sound quality.If you have any questions or problems the seller will respond fast and comfort any requests. Very good seller.

Reviews.Title: Alls Well
Reviews.Author: KJ Steve
Reviews.Content: I have had the watch now for six weeks. It keeps time great, Bluetooth works great, comfortable to wear when sized. No problems with the camera, memory or media player operation. The internet and Java are a issue. They just don't work period. Now its not because the carrier does not support the device, they do. Our experience with the internet suggest we let everyone know who is purchasing this phone for its internet properties to look elsewhere. Attempting to get any kind of help from the manufacture is as useless as the manual sent with the watch to "carefully "guide you through the setup. Unless you are very internet and electronics "savy" ,we have a masters in electronics  engineering design contracted to several electronics institutions, then this one is best left for the internet geeks.

Reviews.Title: its ok
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I like the watch alot but upset from being lied to bout a cupple of thing here in the desrciption.1) the battery life isnt to great at all.play a cupple song or a video and the batterys down to like 1/4 life left.talk time maybe an hour worth not 100-150 minutes.2) it doesn't support a 32gb mem card like they tell you here.on the box it says supports a 16gb mem card.So i wasted my money on the rong mem card cuz they lied to me here.THANKS!!! real nice of you.Also i was missing the stylus thats suppost to be in the watch band and the blue tooth doesnt work.I think it would be a better TOY FOR A KID to use as an mp3 player or someone that doesnt use the phone that much at all.

Reviews.Title: Watch wasn't durable
Reviews.Author: James A Harrison
Reviews.Content: While it worked it was a great watch.  Unfortunately, it just fell apart.  For the price I paid, I expected more quality.

Reviews.Title: Works very well
Reviews.Author: Paxton Grant
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these watches and they came on time, they work perfectly with my T-Mobile SIM just insert it and your good to go. The only issue I have with the item is that i cant get the video, image, and music to work.

Reviews.Title: Very good design but poor workmanship
Reviews.Author: Carlos A. Martinez
Reviews.Content: Most of the functions work OK, but the USB cover felt apart in just 1-week. Waterproof will be make it better

Reviews.Title: Great watch
Reviews.Author: Charles brown
Reviews.Content: I choose this item because it was reasonable in price. I could leave my other phone on the charger with this one I didn't have to worry about picking it up, I could put my iPhone on call forwarding

Reviews.Title: No Bad...but not that great
Reviews.Author: Ant
Reviews.Content: Its a sweet phone, but becarful because the bands on the thing sucks. Bad part is watch places cant replace your bands for ya. The phone is perfect if you go to court alot and you live in a area where they dont allow cell phones in the court room. This watch will pass threw security %100 of the time. I tell my boss and my lady to text me on this phone while im in court...great for a pre paid text only cell phone. It sucks trying to tap those buttons and its even worse trying to get on the internet on the thing. It is what it is, great for keeping in contact with family and friends when your in places where a cell phone will be considered rude or not allowed...it sucks if thats gonna be your only cell phone. TW810 isnt bad for what it is...phone is compatiable to a razor flip phone..lol...not too high tech

Reviews.Title: Battery is not good!
Reviews.Author: Karl-heinz Strauss
Reviews.Content: you will have to recharge it more than you will ware it. It is a joke but a good looking joke.

Reviews.Title: poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Benlivingston
Reviews.Content: Its a cool product, but 2 weeks after buying its charging port started having issues followed shortly by not charging whatsoever. I contacted tyso usa and they said they would contact the supplier and I have yet to hear back from them. I feel as if they will not back up their product it is becoming quite cumbersome trying to resolve this issue, and I honestly doubt they plan on helping me get it replaced. being a part of the us military I am going to pass this on to my fellow soldiers and hope they dont make the same mistake that I have.

Reviews.Title: It Functions Very Well
Reviews.Author: ak5nak3
Reviews.Content: Basically a feature phone on your wrist.  Works fine in Alaska with the local carrier and can carry a second phone, for my business with out the bulk.  I also love the fact that the 32GB micro sim that i placed in it allows the device to double as my flash drive since I am an IT Professional and can carry with me software for various purposes.The only reason I do not give it 5 stars is that It does scratch easily so must be careful when wearing it, the WAP access for MMS and Data is troublesome to set up and must get network data from the carrier you are using to do so.  You also must do it yourself since it is not a "supported" device, which is expected.  Last but not least, the Java interface in the APP store is unreadable as it is in another language.

Reviews.Title: Son loved it
Reviews.Author: Waruna I
Reviews.Content: This was bought for my son, so that he could call me in an emergency. This works very well in most cases, though getting the touch screen calibrated is a nightmare.After a few weeks, it drops the network while on standby. Because if this, though you can always call out from this device, if it has been on standby for anything more than thirty mins, you can forget about calling in, just does not work. But then again, what can you expect from a cheapie? But for what I paid for this,mi got my money's worth by seeing my son's face when this was given to him, he was all :-D

Reviews.Title: Expensive Toy
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL MOINIAN
Reviews.Content: After one month the bracelet is broken.You can not hear the voice from the "speaker"So you should put the watch very very close to your ear.

Reviews.Title: Great Watch Phone, BAD Craftmanship
Reviews.Author: Bee Kaye
Reviews.Content: I have had this Watch phone since January. I works great on T-mobil, Music is fine and if you have a good audio bluetooth it will be great. The speaker is great too. The only problem I have with this watch phone is that the it broke twice. The band is so cheaply made and the shipper will not even fix or repair(they fail to respond to my inquiry). If it had a better band, this would put most of the Pebble, Samsung Gear and other phones to shame. They need a better customer service and better band!!!

Reviews.Title: Good product but a bit flimsy
Reviews.Author: H. L. Wright
Reviews.Content: I found this much better than the Q8 I had purchased.  The keyboard is only on screen and quite small but worked better than the small separate keyboard.  The watch looks good and is a slimmer profile which I loved.  The fact the USB cover fell off the second day and a few days later the wired headset fell apart irritated me quite a bit.  The included Bluetooth headset worked well but the phone had a few anomalies I won't address since I cannot be certain of cause.  The sensitivity for signal strength was excellent.  If they come out with a better unit next year or so, I will probably buy it.  I returned this and went back to a simple flip with no external keys to prevent pocket dialing and a Bluetooth headset.

Reviews.Title: Ok with the price on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Amit
Reviews.Content: Item is ok with the price i paid for this product. But product was good as mentioned and works fine. I gifted this and they liked it so much.

Reviews.Title: Phone watch
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Won't recommend to anyone doesn't work at all inside works good outside. Don't waste your money on it I used mine for a couple of hours and never used it again.

ProductInfo.Features:
Screen: 1.6inch touch screen, TFT LCD 256K colors, QVGA(240 × 240 pixels)
Network: GSM850/900/1800/1900
Memory size: Internal Memory 128MB; Card slot, support  card expansion, the largest expansion to 32 GB
Support:Camera, FM,Mp3 Mp4 Player;USB,Bluetooth
Product Size(mm):46 × 52 × 14.2mm
ProductInfo.Name: Tw810 - 1.6 Inch Unlocked Watch Cell Phone (Java, Mp3, Mp4, Bluetooth)
